sources.title: Tempest (1928) JOHN BARRYMOREüçï CAMILLA HORN
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: John Barrymore, Camilla Horn, Louis Wolheim
Directed by: Sam Taylor, Lewis Milestone (uncredited)
Art Direction: William Cameron Menzies
üçïPresented with the original synchronized orchestral score and sound effectsüçï
During the final days of Czarist rule, as a peasant rises to the rank of lieutenant in the Russian army, his life becomes increasingly difficult by aristocratic officers and the princess he loves. But after the Red Terror rises and the Civil War begins, the tables are turned!

TRIVIA: At the first Academy Awards held in 1929, William Cameron Menzies won the Oscar for Best Production Design for his contributions to The Dove (1927) and Tempest (1928.)

sources.title: Tempest (1928)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Winner of the first Academy Award for Best Art Direction, Tempest followed a Russian peasant who becomes a lieutenant in the army. Bureaucracy and a failed romance with a princess lands him in prison, but his story is not finished there. Reviews and box office from the time of release were not noted, though modern audiences enjoy John Barrymore in the starring role. This version had the best picture quality by far, but used a newer soundtrack and was slightly longer than other versions. I made a couple quick changes to the audio track and now the (mostly) original soundtrack works with this higher quality version.¬†

metadata.Plot: In the final days of Czarist Russia, a peasant is raised from the ranks to Lieutenant. The other officers, aristocrats all, resent him, and make his life difficult. He falls in love with a princess, who spurns him. When he is caught in her room, he is stripped of his rank and thrown into prison. Then comes the Red Terror, and the tables are turned.
metadata.Director: Sam Taylor, Lewis Milestone, Viktor Tourjansky
metadata.Writer: George Marion Jr., Lewis Milestone, Vladimir Nemirovich-Danchenko
metadata.Actors: John Barrymore, Camilla Horn, Louis Wolheim
